diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis of vesicular acetylcholine transporter deficiency was based on findings from whole exome sequencing revealing a homozygous mutation in SLC18A3, consistent with the clinical presentation of severe hypotonia, arthrogryposis, and respiratory failure. The mutation was shown to cause loss of function of VAChT, which is crucial for cholinergic neurotransmission, leading to the observed symptoms. The similar phenotype in VAChT-null mice further supports this diagnosis.
